target_audience.primary_persona: Developers building AI applications with Claude who need to manage, configure, and execute Claude agents through a visual interface rather than command-line tools
secondary_personas: AI/ML Engineers configuring complex agent workflows
DevOps engineers managing MCP server configurations
Technical Product Managers monitoring agent usage and performance
Teams building agentic AI products who need shared agent management
pain_points: Managing Claude agents via CLI or configuration files is cumbersome and error-prone
No visual way to see agent configurations, skills, and their relationships
Difficulty tracking which skills are used by which agents
MCP server configuration scattered across multiple files
No centralized interface for testing and executing agents
Lack of real-time visibility into agent execution
Complex setup required to integrate Claude Agent SDK with custom tools
goals: Quickly create and configure Claude agents through a visual interface
Manage reusable skills and track their usage across agents
Configure and test MCP servers with visual feedback
Execute agents and see real-time streaming output
Import/export configurations for backup and sharing
Have a centralized dashboard for all AI agent assets
target_audience.usage_context: Used during development and operations of Claude-powered AI applications, accessed via web browser on localhost or deployed server, typically during development sprints and agent configuration sessions

product_vision.one_liner: A comprehensive web-based management interface for Claude agents, skills, slash commands, and MCP servers
product_vision.problem_statement: Developers working with Claude agents need to manage complex configurations including agents, skills, MCP servers, and slash commands. Currently, this requires editing multiple configuration files, using CLI tools, and manually tracking relationships between components - leading to errors, duplicated effort, and poor visibility.
product_vision.value_proposition: Provides a visual, intuitive web interface for managing the entire Claude agent ecosystem - from creating agents with AI assistance, to configuring MCP servers, to executing agents with real-time streaming output. Consolidates scattered configuration into a single, user-friendly dashboard.
success_metrics: Number of agents managed through the UI
Time saved in agent configuration vs CLI-only approach

existing_features: Agent Management: Create, edit, view, and delete Claude agents
AI-Powered Agent Creator: Chat-based agent creation using Claude
Agent Execution: Run agents with real-time SSE streaming output
Skills Management: Create, edit skills with YAML frontmatter
Skill References Tracking: See which agents use specific skills
Slash Commands Browser: View and browse available commands
MCP Server Configuration: Add, edit, delete MCP servers
Multiple Transport Support: stdio, SDK, SSE, HTTP transports
Server Testing: Validate MCP server connectivity
Tool Discovery: Browse tools from each MCP server
Import/Export: Backup and restore MCP configurations
Bulk Operations: Manage multiple servers efficiently
Task Management: Create, execute, and monitor tasks
Chat Interface: Chat-based interaction with agents
Flow Builder: Visual workflow builder with @xyflow/react
Authentication: Login/logout with API key management
Health Checks: API health monitoring endpoints

Conversation retrieval from cache/database not implemented

Full MCP server management with visual configuration
AI-assisted agent creation using Claude itself
